intro: Agapetes wardii, commonly known as the Ward's silverleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of Colombia and Ecuador, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of silver-white hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Agapetes wardii is often found growing on shaded rock faces or in humid, well-drained soils.
